title: John Bagot Glubb - The Fate of Empires (epub)
description:
Empires do not begin or end on a certain date, but they do end. The west has not yet come to terms with it's fading supremacy. At the end of every empire, under the guise of renewal, tribes, armies and organizations appear and devour the heritage of the former superpower--often from within. 

In his writings on the fate of empires, the soldier, diplomat and traveler, Lt. General Sir John Glubb analyzed the life-cycles of empires. He found remarkable similarities in them all.  

An empire lasts about 250 years, or ten generations. From the early pioneers to the final conspicuous consumers that become a burden on the state. Six ages define the lifespan of an empire: 

1. the age of pioneers
2. the age of conquests
3. the age of commerce
4. the age of affluence
5. the age of intellect (ending with bread and circuses)
6. the age of decadence
